functions.name: println!
functions.description: Print a string to stdout followed by a newline.

functions.name: print!
functions.description: Print a string to stdout without a trailing newline.

functions.name: error!
functions.description: Print a string to stderr.

functions.name: read_line!
functions.description: Read a line of input from stdin.

functions.name: get!
functions.description: Read an environment variable, returning None if unset.

functions.name: set!
functions.description: Set an environment variable.

functions.name: read!
functions.description: Read a file's contents as a string.

functions.name: write!
functions.description: Write a string to a file, creating or overwriting it.

functions.name: exists!
functions.description: Check if a file path exists.

functions.name: read_file!
functions.description: Read a file's contents as a string.

functions.name: write_file!
functions.description: Write a string to a file, creating or overwriting it.

functions.name: list_dir!
functions.description: List the entries in a directory.

functions.name: with_file!
functions.description: Open a file, pass it to a callback, and close it automatically.

functions.name: get!
functions.description: Send an HTTP GET request to a URL.

functions.name: post!
functions.description: Send an HTTP POST request with a body.

functions.name: put!
functions.description: Send an HTTP PUT request with a body.

functions.name: delete!
functions.description: Send an HTTP DELETE request to a URL.

functions.name: request!
functions.description: Send a custom HTTP request from a request record.

functions.name: to_string
functions.description: Convert an integer to its string representation.

functions.name: parse
functions.description: Parse a string as an integer.

functions.name: parse
functions.description: Parse a JSON string into a value.

functions.name: to_string
functions.description: Serialize a value to a compact JSON string.

functions.name: to_string_pretty
functions.description: Serialize a value to a pretty-printed JSON string.

functions.name: length
functions.description: Return the number of elements in a list.

functions.name: head
functions.description: Return the first element, or None if the list is empty.

functions.name: tail
functions.description: Return all elements except the first.

functions.name: reverse
functions.description: Return the list in reverse order.

functions.name: sort
functions.description: Return the list sorted in ascending order.

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Concatenate two lists.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Check if a list contains a given element.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Return the element at an index, or None if out of bounds.

functions.name: map
functions.description: Apply a function to every element, returning a new list.

functions.name: filter
functions.description: Return elements that satisfy a predicate.

functions.name: fold
functions.signature: fn fold(List<T>, U, (U, T) -> U) -> U
functions.description: Reduce a list to a single value using an accumulator function.

functions.name: find
functions.description: Return the first element that satisfies a predicate, or None.

functions.name: info!
functions.description: Log a message at info level.

functions.name: warn!
functions.description: Log a message at warning level.

functions.name: error!
functions.description: Log a message at error level.

functions.name: debug!
functions.description: Log a message at debug level.

functions.name: empty
functions.description: Create an empty map.

functions.name: insert
functions.signature: fn insert(Map<K, V>, K, V) -> Map<K, V>
functions.description: Insert a key-value pair, returning a new map.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Look up a key, returning Some(value) or None.

functions.name: remove
functions.signature: fn remove(Map<K, V>, K) -> Map<K, V>
functions.description: Remove a key, returning a new map.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Check if a key exists in the map.

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Return all keys as a list.

functions.name: values
functions.description: Return all values as a list.

functions.name: len
functions.description: Return the number of entries in the map.

functions.name: from_list
functions.description: Create a map from a list of (key, value) pairs.

functions.name: abs
functions.description: Return the absolute value of an integer.

functions.name: min
functions.description: Return the smaller of two integers.

functions.name: max
functions.description: Return the larger of two integers.

functions.name: clamp
functions.description: Constrain a value between a minimum and maximum.

functions.name: pow
functions.description: Raise a base to an exponent.

functions.name: unwrap
functions.description: Extract the value from Some, or panic on None.

functions.name: unwrap_or
functions.description: Extract the value from Some, or return a default.

functions.name: is_some
functions.description: Return true if the option contains a value.

functions.name: is_none
functions.description: Return true if the option is None.

functions.name: map
functions.description: Apply a function to the contained value, if present.

functions.name: flat_map
functions.description: Apply a function that returns an Option, flattening the result.

functions.name: int!
functions.description: Generate a random integer between min and max (inclusive).

functions.name: bool!
functions.description: Generate a random boolean.

functions.name: uuid!
functions.description: Generate a random UUID v4 string.

functions.name: header
functions.description: Read a header value from the request.

functions.name: method
functions.description: Return the HTTP method of the request.

functions.name: body_json
functions.description: Parse the request body as JSON.

functions.name: with_state
functions.description: Attach a named state value to the request.

functions.name: state
functions.description: Retrieve a named state value from the request.

functions.name: ok
functions.description: Create a 200 OK response with a text body.

functions.name: json
functions.description: Create a 200 OK response with a JSON body.

functions.name: created
functions.description: Create a 201 Created response with a text body.

functions.name: no_content
functions.description: Create a 204 No Content response.

functions.name: bad_request
functions.description: Create a 400 Bad Request response.

functions.name: not_found
functions.description: Create a 404 Not Found response.

functions.name: error
functions.description: Create a 500 Internal Server Error response.

functions.name: status
functions.description: Create a response with a custom status code and body.

functions.name: with_header
functions.description: Add a single header to a response.

functions.name: with_headers
functions.description: Add multiple headers to a response.

functions.name: redirect
functions.description: Create a 302 temporary redirect to a URL.

functions.name: redirect_permanent
functions.description: Create a 301 permanent redirect to a URL.

functions.name: unwrap
functions.description: Extract the Ok value, or panic on Err.

functions.name: unwrap_or
functions.description: Extract the Ok value, or return a default.

functions.name: is_ok
functions.description: Return true if the result is Ok.

functions.name: is_err
functions.description: Return true if the result is Err.

functions.name: map
functions.description: Apply a function to the Ok value, if present.

functions.name: and_then
functions.signature: fn and_then(Result<T, E>, (T) -> Result<U, E>) -> Result<U, E>
functions.description: Chain a function that returns a Result, flattening the result.

functions.name: new
functions.description: Create a new empty router.

functions.name: routes
functions.description: Return the configured route table.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Register a handler for GET requests at a path.

functions.name: post
functions.description: Register a handler for POST requests at a path.

functions.name: put
functions.description: Register a handler for PUT requests at a path.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Register a handler for DELETE requests at a path.

functions.name: patch
functions.description: Register a handler for PATCH requests at a path.

functions.name: options
functions.description: Register a handler for OPTIONS requests at a path.

functions.name: head
functions.description: Register a handler for HEAD requests at a path.

functions.name: any
functions.description: Register a handler for all HTTP methods at a path.

functions.name: use
functions.description: Add middleware to the router.

functions.name: group
functions.description: Group routes under a shared path prefix.

functions.name: listen!
functions.description: Start the HTTP server on the given port.

functions.name: empty
functions.description: Create an empty set.

functions.name: insert
functions.description: Add an element, returning a new set.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove an element, returning a new set.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Check if an element exists in the set.

functions.name: union
functions.description: Return the union of two sets.

functions.name: intersection
functions.description: Return the intersection of two sets.

functions.name: len
functions.description: Return the number of elements in the set.

functions.name: from_list
functions.description: Create a set from a list of elements.

functions.name: length
functions.description: Return the number of characters in a string.

functions.name: to_upper
functions.description: Convert all characters to uppercase.

functions.name: to_lower
functions.description: Convert all characters to lowercase.

functions.name: trim
functions.description: Remove leading and trailing whitespace.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Check if a string contains a substring.

functions.name: starts_with
functions.description: Check if a string starts with a prefix.

functions.name: ends_with
functions.description: Check if a string ends with a suffix.

functions.name: split
functions.description: Split a string by a delimiter into a list of strings.

functions.name: join
functions.description: Join a list of strings with a separator.

functions.name: slice
functions.description: Extract a substring by start and end index.

functions.name: chars
functions.description: Split a string into a list of single-character strings.

functions.name: char_at
functions.description: Return the character at a given index.

functions.name: index_of
functions.description: Return the index of the first occurrence of a substring, or -1.

functions.name: to_int
functions.description: Parse a string as an integer.

functions.name: from_char_code
functions.description: Create a single-character string from a Unicode code point.

functions.name: char_code
functions.description: Return the Unicode code point of the first character.

functions.name: replace
functions.description: Replace all occurrences of a pattern with a replacement.

functions.name: now!
functions.description: Return the current Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

functions.name: sleep!
functions.description: Pause execution for the given number of milliseconds.

functions.name: downgrade
functions.description: Create a weak reference from a strong reference.

functions.name: upgrade
functions.description: Attempt to upgrade a weak reference to a strong one, returning an Option.
